thread.title: Google takes filth and fury out of typing
thread.title_full: Google takes filth and fury out of typing

title: Google takes filth and fury out of typing
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Google takes filth and fury out of typing Some particularly English words are not deemed offensive enough to a largely American audience Demotix Images Kaya Burgess   
It can be really f annoying to type out long documents by hand, but the way we write online is undergoing a. Of great change. [sic] 
If the above paragraph seems a little unusual, please forgive us. It was written using a new “voice typing” function introduced by Google, which automatically censors swear words and struggles to differentiate between “period” and the same Americanised word for a full stop. The function has been added to Google Docs, the company’s word processing app, and allows users to type with their voice if they are using Google’s Chrome browser. A thorough and Subscribe now
